greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum_{d|n, d=1 mod 3} d.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: G.f.: -q*P'/P where P = prod(n>=0, 1-q^(3*n+1)). [Joerg Arndt, Aug 03 2011]
Conjecture. If a(n)=n+1 then n==1 (mod 3). (Is this easy to settle? It has been verified for n=1,2,3,...,2000.) - John W. Layman, Apr 03 2006
The conjecture is false. The first and only counterexample below 10^8 is a(6800)=6801 and 6800=2 mod 3. - Lambert Herrgesell (zero815(AT)googlemail.com), May 06 2008
mathematica: a[n_] := Plus @@ Select[Divisors[n], Mod[#, 3] == 1 &]; Array[a, 100] (* _Giovanni Resta_, May 11 2016 *)
xref: Cf. Sum_{d|n, d=1 mod k} d: A000593 (k=2), this sequence (k=3), A050449 (k=4).
results.author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Nov 21 2002
